p: A total of 4 neuraminidase inhibitors (NAIs) are currently used in hospitals and clinics in Japan. These include oseltamivir, zanamivir, the inhaled drug, laninamivir, and the intravenous drug, peramivir. Moreover, a new RNA polymerase inhibitor, baloxavir marboxil, was approved in 2018, and was widely used in the 2018â€“19 season [ 4]. It was reported that over 5 million people were treated with baloxavir in Japan.
